meanings.definition: Present tense of the verb 'smug': to smile in a self-satisfied or conceited way.
meanings.sent1: She smugs when she thinks she's right.
meanings.sent2: He always smugs after winning a game.
meanings.sent3: The cat smugs after catching a mouse.
meanings.sent4: The sun smugs down on the peaceful meadow.
meanings.sent5: His face smugs with pride as he shows off his artwork.

meanings.definition: Plural noun: a type of facial expression conveying self-satisfaction or conceit.
meanings.sent1: Their smugs were evident after receiving praise.
meanings.sent2: The painting captured various smugs of the characters.
meanings.sent3: The smugs of the students brightened the classroom.
meanings.sent4: The smugs of the statues seemed to mock the visitors.
meanings.sent5: Her smugs in the mirror revealed her confidence.
